glsa.title: ClamAV: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Two vulnerabilities in ClamAV may allow for the remote execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.

background.p: Clam AntiVirus is a free anti-virus toolkit for UNIX, designed especially for e-mail scanning on mail gateways.

description.p: Moritz Jodeit reported an off-by-one error within the get_unicode_name() function in libclamav/vba_extract.c when processing VBA project files (CVE-2008-5050). Ilja van Sprundel reported an infinite recursion error within the cli_check_jpeg_exploit() function in libclamav/special.c when processing JPEG files (CVE-2008-5314).

impact.p: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted VBA or JPEG file to the clamd daemon, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application or a Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
